example[0]: ‘How was the exam?’ ‘Oh, it was a cinch!’
example[1]: The program is a cinch to install.
note[0]: be a cinch to do something
definition[1]: something that will definitely happen, or someone who will definitely do something
example[2]: Most observers say the president is a cinch to win re-election.
definition[2]: to pull a belt, strap etc tightly around something
example[3]: a blue dress cinched at the waist by a wide belt
definition[3]: to make something certain to happen
example[4]: They cinched a place in the play-off.
